responses.alreadyQueued:
<@{0}> you are already in the queue. 
If you want to leave the queue you can cancel anytime with */cancel*.
responses.enqueue: <@{0}> I added you to the queue. You can leave whenever you like by typing */cancel*
responses.infoUserFilled: Someone enqueued just now <@{0}>. You can get the next person in line with */next*
responses.infoUserEmpty: The queue is empty again. I'll let you know if someone joins. :sunglasses:

responses.notInQueue:
<@{0}> you are currently not in the queue. 
 You are able to join the queue by typing */qme*.
responses.removedUser: <@{0}> I removed you from the queue. You can join again by typing */qme*

responses.empty: <@{0}, the queue is currently empty. If you want me to notice you if someone enqueues you can use */listen*.
responses.numMembers: <@{0}, here are the {1} next members in line.
responses.lessMembers: <@{0}, there aren't {1} members in line. Currently lthere are only {2}.
responses.tooMuch: There currently {0} members in the queue, I can only output {1}. Try to limit the ouput by using */peek <number of people>*.
responses.all: <@{0}>, that's all the members in the queue.

responses.noAdmin: Sorry <@{0}> but I can't give you that Info. Check with someone who can grant you the **Bot Admin** Role.
responses.queueEmpty: Currently there's no one in the queue <@{0}>. I can get back to you if someone enters, simply type */listen*
responses.nextUp: The next user in the queue is <@{0}>. You can put him back into the queue with */putback*.

responses.success: <@{0}, I have put the user <@{1}> back into the queue. :wink:

responses.enqueueFirst:
<@{0}> the queue is empty right now. 
 That's you'r chance be the first and join the queue with */qme*.
responses.notInLine: <@{0}> you are currently not in line. If you want to join the queue you can by typing */qme*
responses.nextUpt: <@{0}> you are next up in the queue! :wink:

responses.stopListen: Okay <@{0}>, but keep in mind that the next members who enqueue will be unnotice. You can always give me a signal with */listen* to start informing you.
responses.startListen: I'll let you know if someone enqueues <@{0}>. If you don't want me to to give you a hint you can type */listen stop*.
responses.alreadyListen: I already noted, that you want hints about the members which enqueued. Don't worry <@{0}> I'll keep you up to date!

responses.general:
<@{0}> you can use the following commands to chat with me: **{1}**.

 If you want more information about a specific command just type */help <name of the command>*.
responses.enqueue: You can use */{1}* to get into the queue. Just type it and leave the rest to me <@{0}>. :+1:
responses.dequeue: <@{0}>, you can get the next person in line with */{1}*. But take care if you take them out of the queue they are out. You can put them back by using */putback*.
responses.cancel: <@{0}>, you can use */{1}* to get out of the queue if you don't want to be in line anymore.
responses.list: <@{0}>, you can use this command to check your place in line. Try it, just type */{1}*.
responses.listen: By typing */{1}* you can make me listen to the queue for you. If someone joins the queue I will give you a hint <@{0}>.

_defaults_.categoryNonExistent: <@{0}> I can't find the configured channel category. You may need to create it and the depending channels for members and admins. You can check your current configuration with */config show*.
_defaults_.messageNotOnCategory: <@{0}>, you can't communication with on this channel. You can check the configuration with */config show*.
_defaults_.wrongChannel: <@{0}>, seems like you are on the wrong channel. The category ist right but should configure a channel named {1} to communicate with me
_defaults_.channelConfig: <@{0}>, you are trying to contact me from a channel which is not configured to be used by bots. You can check you'r configuration by typing */config show*
_defaults_.directMessage: <@{0}>, I'm not up for private chatter. You need to contact me from the server or else I can't enqueue you. :man_shrugging:
